DOC.brief_summary: The efficiency of percutaneous aponeurotomy in the treatment of Dupyutrens disease is well known. However, the duration of the clinical improvement after aponeurotomy is not well known. This study aims primarily at measuring the incidence rate of local relapse of Dupuytrens-induced finger flessum, within two years following treatment by percutaneous aponeurotomy in Dupuytrens.
DOC.brief_title: Percutaneous Aponeurotomy in the Treatment of Dupuytren's Disease
